reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible awesome read
reviews.reviewText: Ball Boy was everything I expected and more. What a story! What a story! Here we have the younger MC going after his Coach. And when they finally came together it was absolutely incredible!Their chemistry was mind blowing and the steamy times they got up to was certainly very creative. Such a fantastic read!And during the third innings, when Wilder and Penn entered the story, it was kicked up a notch for sure. What a dynamic friendship. I could easily read another 200 pages on these MC’s. Enjoyed this book immensely. Loved it! I cannot wait for more in the series!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great age gap sports romance
reviews.reviewText: I do enjoy a good age gap / forbidden romance. This was a fast paced romance between a coach & his star player. For Austin, this wasn't a slow burn. He had a sexual awakening that he laser focused on his coach. To say he was undeterred by Marcus trying to steer his flirtations elsewhere would be understating. Once Austin makes his mind up, it's game over. Marcus didn't want to give in, but after graduation, he couldn't say no anymore; Austin was just too perfect a fit for him.The book is broken up into 3 parts. It flow pretty well, there are some time jumps. We start with Austin at 18 & end up when he's 20 to 21 by the end.Overall, it was a great story. I do have some questions about Sean popping back up & I'm dying to see how Austin's career turns out post college.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hotter than Hot
reviews.reviewText: Ball Boy was Hot, Spicy, with some sweetness. Raquel Riley delivered a well written and developed book. The way Austin goes after Marcus his coach is extremely hot. The love that forms between them is contagious. This book is going to have you swooning and reaching for a cigarette it so hot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wow, this book was hot and sexy! I don’t read any teacher-student type troupes, do I was glad this book moved along past high school. I enjoyed the chemistry between these two and their growing relationship.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gloves and Baseball Bats..
reviews.reviewText: *ARC COPY BOOK REVIEW **“It gave me the courage to come forward, because if there’s even the slightest chance that I could be with you, I don’t want to miss it because I was a coward.”I have been wanting Marcus and Austin's book since I met them a few months ago when I was reading Penn and Wild's the Family Sins duet..y'all the wait was soooo freaking worth it...and boy did I love these two..Austin, him and his sweet cinnamon roll self...finding out things about himself..coming into self realizations..with his dad being his hero..and his best friend going by his parents ideations..he was scared to bring his truth to those around him...noticing and accepting his attraction to older men..more specifically to his coach, Marcus...and this boy went to chase and the flirtation that he definitely did not hold back on..he got bolder it got closer to graduation and afterwards...the night of his final game..he goes after one of the things he truly wants..and takes that step...and they both get what they are craving..Austin getting Marcus..and Marcus getting that perfect boy he has been longing for..While things change in ways that Austin and Coach ends up both hurt from outside sources..moments between him and Coach get even heated and they fall even more for each other."I would do anything for him, give him anything, be anything, for his pleasure, his happiness."Y'all Raquel has a way of bringing some fun into the smexy times one of the things i freaking love about her books..from body parts..🤣..to food...🥵...in her past books..but my God this woman brings the new meaning oiling a baseball glove...how to hold and play with a bat...and Sweet Jesus..that doubleheader..😮‍💨🫠

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kinky Age Gap...
reviews.reviewText: When Austin figures out what he wants, he gets it.. and he's set his sights on Marcus! This book is a non-stop feast for the carnal senses - from Austin's porn stash to Marcus' imagination... and by the time you get to 69% of the book, you finally get full on penetration... I also love how this book intersects with the Family Sins book where we got teased about their relationship, so we see just how Austin and Marcus handle finding out about the family secrets...If you like kinky age gap romance walking the fine line between forbidden and accepted, you'll love Ball Boy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must read if you love Raquel
reviews.reviewText: Austin was absolutely dogged in his hunt to seduce Coach Wolf! I laughed out loud at some of his ridiculous puns and innuendoes. I don't know how Marcus held out as long as he did, as they were obviously perfect for each other. I was happy we got to see their side of the interaction with Wilder and Penn. There was some absolute filth in this book, and it was so good! If you love baseball puns and a praise kink this is definitely for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ball Boy - Batting Practice!
reviews.reviewText: Ball Boy - Batting Practice!‘I could see it, though, the unique qualities in him that set him apart from others, the very qualities I looked for in a partner. Qualities that would make him the perfect boy. Austin had a strong mind and was as determined as anyone to succeed, but he was subservient to the core, a total people pleaser. It was the perfect mix—drive and deference.’Marcus and Austin are Coach/player characters who are finding it hard to stay away from each other. As their relationship quietly and secretly develops, each find needs that the other meets.Raquel Riley creatively ties in these main characters with others from another of her books, which further adds to the tabooish artistry of these stories.Ball Boy is book 1 in the Boy Batter series, which will lead us into more MM baseball romance!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I could not put this book down!! I loved it!! You can always count on Raquel to give you a hot flush or 10!!!I just loved Austin, he’s sweet and dependable, but boy does he know what he wanted and what he wanted was Coach!He was relentless in his pursuit but not forceful. He knew he wanted a daddy and he knew it was Coach who was going to be the one to take care of him.Coach Marcus, tried his best to not cave into Austin and his charm, but let’s face it he had no chance 😂He was a daddy, and he knew Austin would make the perfect boy, but once he gave into him his life was complete.This book was spicy, but it had all the feels and care that comes with a Daddy/Boy book. Marcus knew how to get the best out of Austin, not just in the bedroom.They had some hurdles to get over and some neighbours to deal with, but they were the perfect match and dealt with it together.I loved that the Family Sins men were introduced to this book because wilder is my baby I love him!!
